attributes.action: Make Specialist training in certain procedures the law for plastic surgeons
attributes.additional_details: I was botched twice in the UK after two rhinoplasty surgeries gone wrong. My surgeon was advertised to me as a rhinoplasty specialist - I then learnt he had no specialist training for rhinoplasty procedures but is still legally entitled to call himself a specialist. As a result I am having to travel over seas for a reconstructive rhinoplasty specialist to fix the mess I have been left with.
attributes.background: Plastic surgeons in the UK can call themselves a specialist in a certain surgery without the extensive training. This results in dissatisfied patients and botched results. I want to change this to stop anyone going through the emotional and physical trauma of living with a botched result.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

Unregistered medical practice is already against the law. You can find out more here:

https://www.gmc-uk.org/registration-and-licensing/the-medical-register/a-guide-to-the-medical-register/unregistered-medical-practice

The medical register includes experience and training:

https://www.gmc-uk.org/registration-and-licensing/the-medical-register/a-guide-to-the-medical-register

We're not sure exactly how you'd like the law to change. You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
